p: The Y. lipolytica cells were washed twice with distilled water and harvested by centrifugation at 10,000× g for 1 min. Then, 5 mL of 4 mol/L hydrochloric acid solution was added into the precipitation, and the mixture was retained at room temperature for 20 min, boiled for 5 min and rapidly cooled to −20 °C. Total lipids were extracted twice with 2:1 v/v chloroform-methanol (10 mL). The upper layer was collected, and the solvent was evaporated using a nitrogen streaming instrument (YueXu Technology, Nanjing, China). The sample was converted into fatty acid methyl esters (FAMEs) in 10% ( v/ v) hydrochloric acid-methanol solution at 65 °C for 3 h. Subsequently, the methanol was removed by rotary evaporation under vacuum. FAMEs were extracted by hexane and saturated NaCl solution. The organic residue was collected and stored at −20 °C until use. The residual water was removed using anhydrous Na 2SO 4.
